title: Comment on a paper by Singh and Ullah
abstract: It is shown that the words ‘far weaker’ used four times by Singh and Ullafa [4] in describing their mixing condition in relation to ones of Robinson [1] for establishing the central limit theorem for nonparametric estimators, should in each case be replaced by theword ‘stronger,’ Singh and Ullah's [4] condition being equivalent to complete independence across time

        http://eprints.lse.ac.uk/1348/</dc:relation><dc:title>
        Comment on a paper by Singh and Ullah</dc:title><dc:creator>
        Robinson, Peter</dc:creator><dc:subject>
        HB Economic Theory</dc:subject><dc:description>
        It is shown that the words ‘far weaker’ used four times by Singh and Ullafa [4] in describing their mixing condition in relation to ones of Robinson [1] for establishing the central limit theorem for nonparametric estimators, should in each case be replaced by theword ‘stronger,’ Singh and Ullah's [4] condition being equivalent to complete independence across time.</dc:description><dc:publisher>
        Cambridge University Press</dc:publisher><dc:date>
        1986</dc:date><dc:type>
        Article</dc:type><dc:type>
        PeerReviewed</dc:type><dc:identifier>

        10.1017/S0266466600011415</dc:relation></oai_dc:dc></metadata></record>
